text: The dog that guarded the rebaos of the triform Gerión had two heads and one body, and happily Hercules killed it; the t’ao-t’ieh invents that procedure and is more horrible because the shaven head projects a body to the right and another to the left. It usually has six legs because the front legs serve for the two bodies. FIN
title: El perro de doble cuerpo
author: Jorge Luis Borges
